intro: Alectra senegalensis var. minima, commonly known as the small Senegalese alectra, is a flowering plant native to the Sahel region of Africa. It is a small shrub characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a source of forage for livestock.
